metadata.Title: CVE-2021-34557 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
XScreenSaver 5.45 can be bypassed if the machine has more than tendisconnectable video outputs. A buffer overflow in update_screen_layout()allows an attacker to bypass the standard screen lock authenticationmechanism by crashing XScreenSaver. The attacker must physically disconnectmany video outputs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34557` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xscreensaver - 6.02+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
xscreensaver-data - 6.02+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
xscreensaver-data-extra - 6.02+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
xscreensaver-gl - 6.02+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
xscreensaver-gl-extra - 6.02+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
xscreensaver-screensaver-bsod - 6.02+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
xscreensaver-screensaver-webcollage - 6.02+dfsg1-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xscreensaver package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.02+dfsg1-2ubuntu1').
